member.name: T:ZeroMQ.ZContext
member.summary: Creates instances within a process boundary.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZContext.Encoding
member.summary: Gets and protected sets the default Encoding. Note: Do not set the Encoding after ZContext.Create.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZContext.ContextPtr
member.summary: Gets a handle to the native ZeroMQ context.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZContext.ThreadPoolSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the thread pool for the current context (default = 1).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZContext.MaxSockets
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of sockets for the current context (default = 1024).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZContext.IPv6Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the supported socket protocol(s) when using TCP transports. (Default = ProtocolType.Ipv4).

member.name: T:ZeroMQ.ZDevice
member.summary: Forwards messages received by a front-end socket to a back-end socket, from which they are then sent.
member.remarks: The base implementation of is not threadsafe. Do not construct a device with sockets that were created in separate threads or separate contexts.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.ZDevice.Context
member.summary: The ZContext reference, to not become finalized

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.ZDevice.FrontendSocket
member.summary: The frontend socket that will normally pass messages to .

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.ZDevice.BackendSocket
member.summary: The backend socket that will normally receive messages from (and possibly send replies to) .

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZDevice.BackendSetup
member.summary: Gets a for configuring the frontend socket.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZDevice.FrontendSetup
member.summary: Gets a for configuring the backend socket.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZDevice.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the frontend and backend sockets. Called automatically when starting the device. If called multiple times, will only execute once.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZDevice.Run
member.summary: Start the device in the current thread. Should be used by implementations of the method.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZDevice.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the device and releases the underlying sockets. Optionally disposes of managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor
member.summary: Monitors state change events on another socket within the same context.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Create(System.String,ZeroMQ.ZError@)
member.summary: Create a socket with the current context and the specified socket type.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Create(ZeroMQ.ZContext,System.String,ZeroMQ.ZError@)
member.summary: Create a socket with the current context and the specified socket type.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Connected
member.summary: Occurs when a new connection is established.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.ConnectDelayed
member.summary: Occurs when a synchronous connection attempt failed, and its completion is being polled for.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.ConnectRetried
member.summary: Occurs when an asynchronous connect / reconnection attempt is being handled by a reconnect timer.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Listening
member.summary: Occurs when a socket is bound to an address and is ready to accept connections.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.BindFailed
member.summary: Occurs when a socket could not bind to an address.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Accepted
member.summary: Occurs when a connection from a remote peer has been established with a socket's listen address.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.AcceptFailed
member.summary: Occurs when a connection attempt to a socket's bound address fails.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Closed
member.summary: Occurs when a connection was closed.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.CloseFailed
member.summary: Occurs when a connection couldn't be closed.

member.name: E:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Disconnected
member.summary: Occurs when the stream engine (tcp and ipc specific) detects a corrupted / broken session.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Endpoint
member.summary: Gets the endpoint to which the monitor socket is connected.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Run
member.summary: Begins monitoring for state changes, raising the appropriate events as they arrive.
member.remarks: NOTE: This is a blocking method and should be run from another thread.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the , and optionally disposes of the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEventArgs
member.summary: A base class for the all ZmqMonitor events.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEventArgs.#ctor(ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitor,ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEventData)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEventArgs.Monitor
member.summary: Gets the monitor that triggered the event.

member.name: T:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents
member.summary: Socket transport events (for TCP and IPC sockets) that can be monitored.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.Connected
member.summary: Triggered when a connection has been established to a remote peer.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.ConnectDelayed
member.summary: Triggered when an immediate connection attempt is delayed and it's completion is being polled for.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.ConnectRetried
member.summary: Triggered when a connection attempt is being handled by reconnect timer. The reconnect interval is recomputed for each attempt.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.Listening
member.summary: Triggered when a socket is successfully bound to a an interface.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.BindFailed
member.summary: Triggered when a socket could not bind to a given interface.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.Accepted
member.summary: Triggered when a connection from a remote peer has been established with a socket's listen address.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.AcceptFailed
member.summary: Triggered when a connection attempt to a socket's bound address fails.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.Closed
member.summary: Triggered when a connection's underlying descriptor has been closed.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.CloseFailed
member.summary: Triggered when a descriptor could not be released back to the OS.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.Disconnected
member.summary: Triggered when the stream engine (tcp and ipc specific) detects a corrupted / broken session.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents.AllEvents
member.summary: Any event, maybe readable from EventValue.

member.name: T:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitors
member.summary: Defines extension methods related to monitoring for instances.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitors.Monitor(ZeroMQ.ZSocket,System.String)
member.summary: Spawns a socket that publishes all events for the specified socket over the inproc transport at the given endpoint.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitors.Monitor(ZeroMQ.ZSocket,System.String,ZeroMQ.ZError@)
member.summary: Spawns a socket that publishes all events for the specified socket over the inproc transport at the given endpoint.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitors.Monitor(ZeroMQ.ZSocket,System.String,ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents)
member.summary: Spawns a socket that publishes all events for the specified socket over the inproc transport at the given endpoint.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitors.Monitor(ZeroMQ.ZSocket,System.String,ZeroMQ.Monitoring.ZMonitorEvents,ZeroMQ.ZError@)
member.summary: Spawns a socket that publishes all events for the specified socket over the inproc transport at the given endpoint.

member.name: T:ZeroMQ.RouterMandatory
member.summary: Specifies socket behavior when an unroutable message is encountered.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.RouterMandatory.Report
member.summary: Force sending to fail with an 'EAGAIN' error code, effectively enabling blocking sends.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.SocketOption.ReconnectIvl
member.summary: 重新连接时间间隔(最小)

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.SocketOption.ReconnectIvlMax
member.summary: 重新连接时间间隔(最长)(200+400+800)

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.SocketOption.TcpKeepaliveIdle
member.summary: TCP发送keepalive消息的频度,单位秒

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.SocketOption.TcpKeepaliveIntvl
member.summary: 当探测没有确认时，重新发送探测的频度,单位秒

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.SocketState.Pause
member.summary: 对象正常但因暂停而不可用

member.name: T:ZeroMQ.TcpKeepaliveBehaviour
member.summary: Keep-alive packets behavior for a connection.

member.summary: Sends HARD bytes from a byte[n]. Please don't use SendBytes, use instead SendFrame.

member.summary: Sends HARD bytes from a byte[n]. Please don't use SendBytes, use instead SendFrame.

member.summary: Sends HARD bytes from a byte[n]. Please don't use SendBytes, use instead SendFrame.

member.summary: Sends HARD bytes from a byte[n]. Please don't use SendBytes, use instead SendFrame.

member.returns: 1 发送成功 0 发送失败 -1部分发送

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.Subscribe(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Subscribe to messages that begin with a specified prefix.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.Subscribe(System.String)
member.summary: Subscribe to messages that begin with a specified prefix.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.Unsubscribe(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Unsubscribe from messages that begin with a specified prefix.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.Unsubscribe(System.String)
member.summary: Unsubscribe from messages that begin with a specified prefix.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.ReceiveMore
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the multi-part message currently being read has more message parts to follow.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.AddTcpAcceptFilter(System.String)
member.summary: Add a filter that will be applied for each new TCP transport connection on a listening socket. Example: "127.0.0.1", "mail.ru/24", "::1", "::1/128", "3ffe:1::", "3ffe:1::/56"
member.remarks: If no filters are applied, then TCP transport allows connections from any IP. If at least one filter is applied then new connection source IP should be matched.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.ClearTcpAcceptFilter
member.summary: Reset all TCP filters assigned by and allow TCP transport to accept connections from any IP.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.Affinity
member.summary: Gets or sets the I/O thread affinity for newly created connections on this socket.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.Backlog
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of the queue of outstanding peer connections. (Default = 100 connections).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.IdentityString
member.summary: Gets or sets the Identity. Note: The string contains chars like \0 (null terminator, which are NOT printed (in LogRecorder.Debug)!

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.Linger
member.summary: Gets or sets the linger period for socket shutdown. (Default = , infinite).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.MaxMessageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size for inbound messages (bytes). (Default = -1, no limit).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.MulticastHops
member.summary: Gets or sets the time-to-live field in every multicast packet sent from this socket (network hops). (Default = 1 hop).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.MulticastRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum send or receive data rate for multicast transports (kbps). (Default = 100 kbps).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.ReceiveBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the underlying kernel receive buffer size for the current socket (bytes). (Default = 0, OS default).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.ReceiveHighWatermark
member.summary: Gets or sets the high water mark for inbound messages (number of messages). (Default = 0, no limit).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.ReceiveTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for receive operations. (Default = , infinite).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.ReconnectInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial reconnection interval. (Default = 100 milliseconds).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.ReconnectIntervalMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum reconnection interval. (Default = 0, only use ).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.MulticastRecoveryInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the recovery interval for multicast transports. (Default = 10 seconds).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.SendBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the underlying kernel transmit buffer size for the current socket (bytes). (Default = 0, OS default).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.SendHighWatermark
member.summary: Gets or sets the high water mark for outbound messages (number of messages). (Default = 0, no limit).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.SendTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout for send operations. (Default = , infinite).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.TcpKeepAlive
member.summary: Gets or sets the override value for the SO_KEEPALIVE TCP socket option. (where supported by OS). (Default = -1, OS default).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.TcpKeepAliveCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the override value for the 'TCP_KEEPCNT' socket option (where supported by OS). (Default = -1, OS default). The default value of '-1' means to skip any overrides and leave it to OS default.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.TcpKeepAliveIdle
member.summary: Gets or sets the override value for the TCP_KEEPCNT (or TCP_KEEPALIVE on some OS). (Default = -1, OS default).

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZSocket.TcpKeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the override value for the TCP_KEEPINTVL socket option (where supported by OS). (Default = -1, OS default).

member.summary: 关联的站点名称（仅用于MicroZero）

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.ZSocketFlags.DontWait
member.summary: The operation should be performed in non-blocking mode.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.ZSocketFlags.More
member.summary: The message being sent is a multi-part message, and that further message parts are to follow.

member.name: T:ZeroMQ.ZSocketSetup
member.summary: Defines a fluent interface for configuring device sockets.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocketSetup.Bind(System.String)
member.summary: Configure the socket to bind to a given endpoint.
member.param: A string representing the endpoint to which the socket will bind.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocketSetup.Connect(System.String)
member.summary: Configure the socket to connect to a given endpoint. See for details.
member.param: A string representing the endpoint to which the socket will connect.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocketSetup.Subscribe(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Configure the socket to subscribe to a specific prefix.
member.param: A byte array containing the prefix to which the socket will subscribe.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZSocketSetup.SubscribeAll
member.summary: Configure the socket to subscribe to all incoming messages. See for details.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.ZSocketType.ROUTER
member.remarks: When receiving messages a socket shall prepend a message part containing the identity of the originating peer to the message before passing it to the application. When sending messages a ZMQ_ROUTER socket shall remove the first part of the message and use it to determine the identity of the peer the message shall be routed to. If the peer does not exist anymore the message shall be silently discarded.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.ZSocketType.XPUB
member.remarks: Subscription message is a byte '1' (for subscriptions) or byte '0' (for unsubscriptions) followed by the subscription body.

member.name: F:ZeroMQ.ZSocketType.XSUB
member.remarks: Subscription message is a byte '1' (for subscriptions) or byte '0' (for unsubscriptions) followed by the subscription body.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class.

member.name: P:ZeroMQ.ZThread.IsCancellationRequested
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the device loop is running.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Start(System.Threading.CancellationTokenSource)
member.summary: Start the device in the current thread.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Join
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the device terminates.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Join(System.Int32)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the device terminates.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Join(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Blocks the calling thread until the device terminates or the specified time elapses.
member.param: A set to the amount of time to wait for the device to terminate.
member.returns: true if the device terminated; false if the device has not terminated after the amount of time specified by has elapsed.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Stop
member.summary: Stop the device in such a way that it can be restarted.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Close
member.summary: Stop the device and safely terminate the underlying sockets.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the current instance, including the frontend and backend sockets.

member.name: M:ZeroMQ.ZThread.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Stops the device and releases the underlying sockets. Optionally disposes of managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
